name: Martin Kirov
title: System Engineer · Linux/Windows · DevOps
summary: Hands-on system engineer (Linux/Windows) who loves coding, scripting, and automation. I build reliable services, wire up clean networks, and secure systems against misconfigurations and exploits. I’m deeply curious about cloud infrastructure (Terraform/AWS), trading automation, and how blockchains work under the hood. Calm under pressure, obsessed with learning, and I prefer repeatable, containerized deployments with solid observability.

highlights: Owned Windows-based infra for hotel complex (~80 users) across multiple VLANs.
Administered AD DS, DNS, DHCP, GPO; file/print services, updates, and backups.
Hardened access policies, password/GPO baselines; ensured GDPR-aligned logging.
Managed VLAN segmentation, L3 switching, site VPN tunnels, and firewall logging.
Integrated SALTO access control and electronic locks with directory services.
Ran DHCP/DNS, file servers, backups & monitoring; tuned Wi-Fi and PoE stacks.
Investigated firewall logs to prevent misuse and maintain service health.
Remote setup & troubleshooting for Eero mesh networks and smart devices.
Resolved connectivity/performance issues across varied ISP environments.
Documented fixes and kept rigorous CRM notes to accelerate future cases.
